website_summaries.verdict: The Epson WorkForce DS-760 Color Document Scanner delivers fast scan speeds, an 80-sheet automatic document feeder, and duplex (two-sided) scanning.
pros: Excellent text recognition and document management
cons: Only included application software is the light version of an optical character recognition program

customer_reviews.title: Scaner works like a champ, but software is flaky
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is a workhorse. I've scanned more than 1200 books so far (bindings removed) with very little trouble. The scanner does a nice job of dealing with minor page deformities (tears, stuck pages). The software is flaky and requires a reboot far too frequently. I wish the scanner had a larger paper capacity or the software had the ability to stitch PDFs together (most books generated three or more PDF files that had to be manually combined later). Does not scan to Word format at all, just PDF, JPG, or TIFF; however, it can be set to do character recognition within the PDF setting.
customer_reviews.author: GPS

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great scanner, speedy too. Had an older Workforces GS-50 previously for several years until it finally died. It was at a time when I needed to finish a lot of scanning (!!) and decided to replace with the same GS-50, but it was no longer available. This machine is very good and scans very speedily. The quality of scans is as good as the GS-50. I'm sure it can do a lot of things better but have not played too much with it as its used primarily for office scanning of documents. Cons: Price. Its expensive. In this world electronics, I'm surprised it would cost this much.
customer_reviews.author: Shailesh

customer_reviews.title: The scanner itself is great. In my office
customer_reviews.text: The scanner itself is great. In my office, clients have multiple multi-page documents. We like to have each document saved as separate files within each client's folder. We followed the instructions as written in both the print and online manuals and they did not work. We called tech support. The first level person did not even begin to understand the problem. The next level person, after nearly two hours on the phone with him, said it could not be done. My assistant finally clicked something that was not in the instructions and it worked. If it weren't for lousy, uninformed tech support, I would give this scanner a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is really great! It is fast and so efficient, it makes life so much easier to scan a few hundred pages of documents in a matter of a few minutes. As with any other scanner, it sometimes gets jammed and pulls through two or more pages at once when they stick together but you will find that with any scanner you buy. This is definitely a high functioning scanner and great if you have a lot of paperwork to scan in. The program is also very easy to use. Definitely worth the price, I would highly recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.

customer_reviews.title: Great fast scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is fast. I have quite a few papers that I have to run through and the old flat bed was just painful having to scan anything more than 10 pages. This has been working great for me in scanning genealogy documents, older manuals, etc. It isn't all perfect as it can have some problems feeding glossy sheets (it slips so the resulting scan is elongated) and the OCR software doesn't interface well (the software throws an error when it tries to make a scan but if you feed it a TIFF from a scan it works great).
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This little workhorse is fantastic. We have used to convert over ten full ...
customer_reviews.text: This little workhorse is fantastic. We have used to convert over ten full file cabinets full of paper into digital PDF files. It is compact, yet sturdy. It is very reliable and very fast. Undoubtedly the best office product I've purchased in years!
customer_reviews.author: BCRich

customer_reviews.title: This is a fast workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is super fast. I had a Epson GT-S50 before and I used it for about four years before I started having problems with it. I ordered this one and the speed is unbelievably fast. The scanned documents are a little lighter than what my old scanned produced but they are very clear. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: ncr

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Jams easily. Within the third week it would jam and lose connection with the PC. That meant anything scanned but not saved was lost. The only way to get it to reconnect was to shutdown the PC and turn off scanner. Then restart. Since it jammed every four or five scans, back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Reading is fun

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, fast, clear and quiet. For this much money, better software should be included. It would be much better if I had complete control of all scanner settings. for example, to be able to scan photos without ANY photo adjustment added to it. and ALSO to be able to calibrate the scanner would have been great. I would still recommend this scanner to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Gigante Sr.

customer_reviews.title: I had an Epson G50S that I replaced with this and it's like night and day
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I had an Epson G50S that I replaced with this and it's like night and day. This thing scans FAST. It saves me tons of time and the quality of the scans is terrific. No issues using it with Windows 10 either. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Truth

customer_reviews.title: Great document feeder!!!
customer_reviews.text: The 80 page document feeder worked great. What had taken a very long time, on a scanner that was suppose to be a 20 page "auto feeder", because of the imbedded software and paper jams literally took a few minutes on the Epson. I no longer dread the task of creating a PDF in excess of 50 pages. The price was well worth the quality of the finished product! The referenced task was in excess of 60 pages in length.
customer_reviews.author: William Campi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this scanner. Super fast and easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: Angela Tanong

customer_reviews.title: It is very fast
customer_reviews.text: The software is easy to set up and it quickly scans front and back at the same time. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Cleary

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best scanner, extremely fast, multiple modes and resolutions. Very dependable. Has streamlined my business!!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scanner for 2.5 months and already the separation roller has broken. I have not scanned anywhere near 200,000 pages through this machine. Not very happy as I am now 2 days behind at work.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Walters

customer_reviews.title: gets job done but not a long term product.
customer_reviews.text: I hate having to pay this much for a scanner. Previous one only lasted 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, very fast, I do miss the page counter though
customer_reviews.author: steve saevig

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this scanner to anyone in search of one
customer_reviews.text: This scanner met all our expectations. Its compact and very fast. I recommend this scanner to anyone in search of one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fast and easy.
customer_reviews.text: i dont how i got anything done before without this. fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: salah haggag

customer_reviews.title: Ours work good except 1 of 4 rollers broke after 10
customer_reviews.text: Ours work good except 1 of 4 rollers broke after 10,000 scans in 3 months. Epson says the part should be good for 100,000 scans, well, not ours. I didn't bother returning the whole unit as Epson recommended. I wanted Epson to send just to broken piece to me as I didn't want our department with a scanner. Didn't want to provide my CC either to hold while defective device is being shipped back. I ended up buying the roller kit so I can use the scanner again. Other than that, the device is fast and easy to setup. See photo when I compared the worn out piece.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Marasigan

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had ordered this scanner a year ago.
customer_reviews.text: It's setup is seamless and it is very, very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this and there is no mention anywhere that ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and there is no mention anywhere that it doesn't work with Mac. Now I have to return, likely at my cost. It is so strange to me that anyone would make a product that isn't compatible with Mac, considering they are widely used. I called their support line and after fifteen minutes the rep told me this model flat out isn't compatible with Mac. There isn't even a driver for it online elsewhere. UGH!
customer_reviews.author: Slade

customer_reviews.title: Delivers fast scan speeds, and 80-sheet automatic document feeding
customer_reviews.text: This Epson WorkForce DS-760 Color Document Scanner delivers fast scan speeds, an 80-sheet automatic document feeder, and duplex (two-sided) scanning. Pros: + Automatic document feeder. + Fast. + Duplex (two-sided) scanning. + Excellent text recognition and document management. Cons: - Only included application software is the light version of an optical character recognition program. A worthy comparison on price and spec would be this Canon:
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speed and scan quality.  Software not great, and no native Mac support.
customer_reviews.text: I know they tell you ahead of time that the included software doesn't support Mac. And basically, try to use this scanner with a Mac at your own peril. (Our household has both Mac and PC, so I was willing to take the risk.) But really? In today's market, with Mac having a very meaningful marketshare, can't you just support both? Anyhow, once working on the PC, scan speed and quality was excellent. I chose to use other software that I already had installed, rather than the included software, which I found clunky. This has very robust build quality, and I really liked the buttons and interface on the scanner itself.
customer_reviews.author: W. Munro

customer_reviews.title: Need for Speed
customer_reviews.text: One of the amazing things about this scanner is that it is lightning fast, yet has a small footprint. That makes it a terrific addition to a home business or a consultant with limited space, as well as a small to mid-size office. It comes with Document Capture Pro, which alows you to shuffle, add, and delete. Next you can save to a wide variety of formats such as jpeg, PDF, and BMP files. Recognition is excellent, scans are crisp and clear. If you have high volume needs, this scanner gets it done, and without wasting time.
customer_reviews.author: ShannonOnTheLakes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful compact scanner
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful scanner, not only does it scan in black and white, it also scans in color and you choose where to save documents. I also have another document scanner which is more complicated and then had to purchase online storage at a monthly or yearly cost. I have scanned receipts, papers, books that have fallen apart, basically a little of everything and this works perfect every time. I am unsure of all the other bad reviews here on amazon, I love this little scanner, it fits perfectly on the edge of the desk, it is compact and works like a big machine. I would highly recommend this and plan to purchase another for work. 5 stars, highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry South

customer_reviews.title: Great for a sub-$1000 scanner, so long as (1) you don't need to do huge number of pages at once, and (2) you don't have a Mac
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Fujitsu and Epson scanners of this basic design for more than a decade. Fujitsu's software is still the best, and is platform agnostic. Epson's runs on Windows only. The main advantage to this unit is the speed, which is blazing compared to any sub-$1500 scanner I have ever used. Given the amazing speed I was surprised that the paper feed is designed to hold only 80 pages. Generally, the ability of these units to separate pages degrades over time, if I run into problems there I will post an addendum to this review.
customer_reviews.author: Neurasthenic

customer_reviews.title: Windows only, fantastic scan quality.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is so blazingly fast and efficient!! It has incredibly high scan quality and even has a setting to remove the signs of hole punched pages from the scanned images. It was a little confusing to set up and I had to call customer support to be walked though it, but they helped me and then everything was great. There was a conflict somehow since I already had an Epson printer on my system. Also, it's important to note that this scanner does NOT work with Macs. Only Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Fuji

customer_reviews.title: I work in a church environment so we needed a scanner that could provide excellent images, OCR technology
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has been a life saver! I work in a church environment so we needed a scanner that could provide excellent images, OCR technology, fit into a simple system, and easily used by volunteers without a steep learning curve...no small order! But the DS-860 delivered and continues to make a daunting task seem like a walk in the park. We literally had large closets and classrooms of archived paper now being reduced to electronic folders of accessible data. Now we can use those rooms for people instead of paper! Thanks Epson!
customer_reviews.author: joseph r. myers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performing Scanner- Too Bad It Does Not Support Mac
customer_reviews.text: This scanners performance is excellent. It works very fast and provides good quality output. I installed the software on a Win 10 system without any problems. I found only one missing feature. Epson does not provide any Mac OS capability. This was surprising to me since in the past when I have tested Epson scanners I could always go the Epson download site and get Mac software. Not for this scanner! That is the only weakness I could fine with this otherwise fine product. All in all it is an excellent product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Advertising
customer_reviews.text: Epson's advertising is deceptive. The picture shows a long sheet of paper fed in sideways, implying it can take an 11"x14" sized sheet of paper. The description even says it can take a 11"x17" folded sheet of paper. I naively thought it would unfold the sheet as it scanned, saving time. The scanner is only 8.5" wide, which means you have to fold the 11"x17" paper in two, creating a 8.5"x11" to scan. If you want both sides scanned, you have to fold it the other way and re-scan, increasing the labor and wasting time.
customer_reviews.author: MrJive

customer_reviews.title: The Epson DS-760 is a superior product. I have used various scanners over the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Epson DS-760 is a superior product. I have used various scanners over the years for records management purposes and have found some that I 'could use' because of their functionality however this scanner provides both efficiency and quality performance in one machine. The DPI settings allow you to gauge your internal work product while meeting standards set by regulatory agencies. The DS 760 integrates with our records management system with ease and has increased my work productivity. If you are in the market for a high quality scanner that both produces and exceeds the industry standard, this would be my recommendation. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Meegan Morgan, Town of Brownsburg

customer_reviews.title: Misleading specs
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!!! You will see this advertised as an 11x17 scanner. It is not. The 11x17 claim is for folded pages. Which means it is basically a lie since you can make any size if you're willing to stitch stuff together. This could be a potentially expensive mistake at this high price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: this scanner is useless to us
customer_reviews.text: bought this to scan images with barcodes .tiff format, will not use cctt4 compression, it lets you think you're setting it that way, but the scan always ends up being 6 which we can not use, this scanner is useless to us.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B Carman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Rollers wears off very quickly and needed replacement, does not last long as claimed
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: A constant source of frustration. Unreliable and inconsistent performance. Frequent restarts and software reloads. One minute it works, the next - nothing. I wish I had stuck with HP rather than believe the sales literature.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Hirst

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce DS-760 Hi Speed, Sheet-Fed Color Document Scanner, 80 page Auto Document Feeder (ADF) & Duplex (B11B222202)
product_meta.description: Style:Up to 45 ppm/90 Ipmfast, Easy Scanning. Efficient Document Management. Offering World-class Performance For Fast-paced Businesses, The High-speed Workforce Ds-760 Document Scanner Was Designed For Easy Operation In Heavy-use Environments. Speeding Through Scans Up To 45 Ppm, It Also Features Auto Paper Size Detection And Dynamic Skew Correction To Prevent Paper Jams And Avoid Downtime. A Robust And Reliable Workhorse, The Ds-760 Includes An 80-page Adf And A High Daily Duty Cycle. Twain And Isis Compatibility Make It Ideal For Use With Existing Professional Document Management Systems. And Advanced Image Adjustments Make Getting Sharp Scans Simple. The Ds-760 Even Scans Directly To Popular Cloud Services. It's The Efficient Way To Scan Critical Documents And Get Them To Their Destination.
feature_bullets: 45 ppm/90 ipm scan speeds; scans both sides in just one pass
Dynamic skew correction prevents miss-feeds and paper jams
80-page Automatic Document Feeder, duty cycle of up to 4500 sheets per day
Compatible with existing office software; supports TWAIN and ISIS drivers
Advanced color and image adjustments and other innovative features

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars73 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
